greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle of increasing mobiles (circular rooted trees) with n nodes and k leaves.
comment: In an increasing rooted tree, nodes are numbered and numbers increase as you move away from root.
This is also related to the solution of the equation df/dt=f e^f (see the Maple code). - _F. Chapoton_, Jul 16 2004
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275 (first 50 rows)
Shi-Mei Ma, Some combinatorial sequences associated with context-free grammars, arXiv:1208.3104v2 [math.CO], 2012. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 21 2012
Index entries for sequences related to mobiles
maple: P[1]:=1;for n from 1 to 8 do P[n+1]:=simplify((1+n*x)*P[n]+x*diff(P[n],x)) end; # _F. Chapoton_, Jul 16 2004
mathematica: Array[row, 10] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Nov 17 2018, after _F. Chapoton_ *)
program: A(n)={my(v=vector(n)); v[1]=y; for(n=2, #v, v[n]=v[n-1] + sum(k=1, n-2, binomial(n-2, k)*v[k]*v[n-k])); vector(#v, i, Vecrev(v[i]/y, i))}
results.author: _Christian G. Bower_, May 15 2000
